clusterList.phrase: factors that probably influenced the actions of the truck driver included a low expectation that a train would be encountered at the crossing failure to sight the train due to glare from the sun and possibily fatigue
based on the evidence there was nothing that the drivers of train 3835 could have done to prevent or lessen the impact of the collision with the semi-trailer
the age of the driver was one of the things taken into consideration relative to driver reaction times
